comments.title: Typical Wear
comments.body: Typical wear was observed on flooring surfaces at (location). These conditions are common in previously owned homes and are cosmetic in nature.

ai.notes: Use for normal age-related flooring wear.

comments.title: Loose Flooring
comments.body: Loose or unsecured flooring material was observed at (location). This should be repaired to help prevent further deterioration or tripping hazards.

comments.title: Damaged Flooring
comments.body: Damaged flooring was observed at (location). Repair or replacement is recommended as needed.

comments.title: Damaged LVP
comments.body: Loose or damaged LVP flooring was observed at (location). Repairs are recommended.

comments.title: Cracked Tile
comments.body: Cracked tile was observed at (location). Monitor for additional cracking. Replacement may be desirable for cosmetic or functional reasons.

comments.title: Trip Hazard – Transition
comments.body: A flooring transition at (location) is raised and presents a trip hazard. Adjustment or repair is recommended for safety.

comments.title: Trip Hazard – Uneven Floor
comments.body: Uneven flooring was observed at (location), creating a trip hazard. Repairs are recommended.

comments.title: Poor Installation
comments.body: Flooring installation appears to be of lower workmanship quality at (location), such as uneven seams or misaligned boards. This is primarily cosmetic.

comments.title: Gaps in Flooring
comments.body: Gaps in flooring were noted at (location). Repairs may be desirable for appearance or to prevent debris accumulation.

comments.title: Carpet Wear
comments.body: Carpet wear was observed at (location), consistent with age and use.

comments.title: Carpet Loose
comments.body: Carpet is loose or buckled at (location). Stretching or reinstallation is recommended.

comments.title: Window Maintenance
comments.body: General window maintenance such as cleaning, lubricating, and adjustments is recommended to ensure proper function and prevent deterioration.

comments.title: Disrepair
comments.body: The windows are in mild disrepair. Trimming, adjustment, hardware improvements, or glazing repairs may be needed.

comments.title: Older Windows
comments.body: Older windows require ongoing maintenance. Wear consistent with age was observed at (location).

comments.title: Painted Shut
comments.body: One or more windows at (location) are painted shut. This prevents egress and natural ventilation. Repairs are recommended.

comments.title: Hardware Nonfunctional
comments.body: Window hardware (lock, crank, or latch) was nonfunctional at (location). Repair is recommended.

comments.title: Difficult to Operate
comments.body: A window at (location) is difficult to operate. Cleaning, lubrication, or adjustment may be needed.

comments.title: Chronic Leakage
comments.body: The window at (location) shows signs of chronic leakage. Sealing, flashing correction, or repair may be needed.

comments.title: Water Stains Around Window
comments.body: Water staining was noted around the window at (location). The area was dry at inspection. Consult the seller about prior leaks.

comments.title: Lost Seal / Fogged Window
comments.body: A window at (location) shows a failed thermal seal with fogging or condensation between panes.

comments.title: Glass Cracked or Damaged
comments.body: The window glass at (location) is cracked or damaged. Replacement is recommended.

comments.title: Screens Missing or Damaged
comments.body: Window screens are missing or damaged at (location). Replacement may be desirable.

comments.title: Caulk Gaps at Window Trim
comments.body: Gaps in caulking were noted at the interior trim of the window at (location). Caulking is recommended.

comments.title: Interior Condensation
comments.body: Condensation was noted on the interior surface of the window at (location). Often related to humidity levels.

comments.title: Typical Window Wear
comments.body: Minor cosmetic wear was observed on window trim or finishes at (location).

comments.title: Preowned Home Typical Flaws
comments.body: Typical drywall flaws were observed, including minor cracks, scuffs, and small holes from household items hung on walls.

comments.title: New Build Typical Drywall Flaws
comments.body: Minor visible seams, nail pops, and surface imperfections were noted in this new construction. These are common as materials settle.

comments.title: Water Staining Dry
comments.body: An area of water staining was noted at (location). The area was dry at the time of inspection. Consult seller for additional information.

comments.title: Water Damage
comments.body: Water damage was noted at (location). Repairs may be needed depending on severity.

comments.title: Active Leak
comments.body: An active leak was identified at (location). Moisture meter and infrared confirmed elevated moisture. Repair is recommended.

comments.title: Patching
comments.body: Evidence of patching was detected at (location). Monitor for changes that may indicate an underlying issue.

comments.title: Finish Damage
comments.body: Damage to the interior finish was observed at (location). Repairs may be desirable.

comments.title: Large Cracks
comments.body: Larger-than-typical cracks were noted at (location). These may indicate underlying movement. Monitor for worsening.

comments.title: Plaster Bulging
comments.body: The plaster shows evidence of bulging at (location). Repairs may be desirable.

comments.title: Fire Separation
comments.body: Appropriate fire separation is recommended at (location).

comments.title: Mold Visible
comments.body: What appears to be organic growth resembling mold was observed at (location). Further testing is recommended.

comments.title: Popcorn Ceiling
comments.body: Textured or 'popcorn' ceiling material was visible at (location). Asbestos testing is beyond the scope of the inspection.

comments.title: Ghosting
comments.body: Ghosting on drywall ceilings was noted at (location). This is usually related to temperature differences, humidity, or soot.

comments.title: Door Adjustments
comments.body: Doors should be trimmed or adjusted as necessary to operate and seal properly.

comments.title: Loose or Damaged Hardware
comments.body: Damaged, nonfunctional, or missing door hardware should be repaired or replaced.

comments.title: Loose Door Knob
comments.body: Loose or nonfunctioning door knobs should be repaired or replaced.

comments.title: Closet Door Guide
comments.body: Interior sliding closet doors should have proper floor guides installed to operate correctly.

comments.title: Sliding Door Rollers
comments.body: The rollers of the sliding glass door could be improved to operate freely.

comments.title: Old Sliding Door
comments.body: The sliding glass door is old. Older doors may require increased maintenance.

comments.title: Sliding Door Hardware
comments.body: The hardware for the sliding glass door is damaged and should be repaired or replaced.

comments.title: Sliding Door Threshold Leakage
comments.body: Evidence of leakage was observed at the sliding door threshold. Monitor during heavy rains.

comments.title: Fire-Rated Door Missing
comments.body: The door between the garage and the house does not appear fire-rated. A properly rated door is recommended.

comments.title: Door Not Sealed Against Fumes
comments.body: The garage-to-house door is not properly sealed against vehicle fumes.

comments.title: Garage Entry Door Adjustment
comments.body: The garage entry door should be adjusted to operate freely while still fitting tightly.
